sentence.Network_en: He is utterly ignorant of staff [ stave ] .
sentence.Network_cn: 他对 五线谱 一窍不通.

sentence.Network_en: Many people switch on the television simply to stave off boredom over the Christmas break.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人打开电视仅仅是为了打发圣诞节休息期间的无聊时光而已。

sentence.Network_en: In a desperate attempt to stave off defeat, he reluctantly promised wholesale reform of the constitution.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了竭力避免败局，他勉强答应要对宪法进行大规模修改。

jx.jx_en_mean: To keep or hold off; repel
jx.jx_cn_mean: 阻止：不使接近； 赶走

lj.lj_ly: “For 12 years, we've sought to stave off this ultimate threat of disaster”(&b{New York Times})
lj.lj_ls: “12年来，我们一直寻求赶走灾难的最终威胁”(&b{纽约时报})

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: back-formation from staves.  Current senses of the verb date from the early 17th cent

entry.def: A stave is a strong stick, especially one that is used as a weapon.

example.ex: Many of the men had armed themselves with staves and pieces of iron.
example.tran: 很多人用棍棒和铁器将自己武装起来。

entry.def: A stave is the five lines that music is written on.

means.word_mean: 1. (music) the system of five horizontal lines on which the musical notes are written
2. one of several thin slats of wood forming the sides of a barrel or bucket
3. a crosspiece between the legs of a chair
2. burst or force (a hole) into something

auth_sentence.content: But a rally in October helped stave off the punishment.
auth_sentence.res_content: But a rally in October helped stave off the punishment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But a rally in October helped stave off the punishment.

auth_sentence.content: These have helped stave off mass unemployment.
auth_sentence.res_content: These have helped stave off mass unemployment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These have helped stave off mass unemployment.

auth_sentence.content: The world must work together to stave off a new recession.
auth_sentence.res_content: The world must work together to stave off a new recession.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The world must work together to stave off a new recession.

sentences.en: The side of the boat was staved in when it hit the rocks.

means.word_mean: 暂时挡住，避开(某事)；延缓，推迟(令人不快的事物)

sentences.en: desperate attempts to stave off civil war
sentences.cn: 孤注一掷地避免内战的努力

sentences.en: I staved off jet lag with a bath and an early night.
sentences.cn: 我洗了个澡又提前睡下，免除飞行时差的反应。
